title: The Rhythm of the Upper Room
excerpt: Before the movement went to the ends of the earth, it began in a quiet room of waiting. We explore how stillness in our own homes is the prerequisite for spiritual power.

title: Hospitality as a Holy Calling
excerpt: The early church didn't have cathedrals; they had dinner tables. Discover why the simple act of opening your door is a profound theological statement.

title: Walking with the Spirit in the Mundane
excerpt: Faith isn't just for the mountain tops; it's for the laundry room and the commute. Learn to see the fingerprints of the Divine in your everyday routine.

title: Paul's Journey: The Strength in Weakness
excerpt: Examining the thorns in our sides. How the Apostle Paul's limitations became the very channels through which the movement found its greatest strength.
